body.p:
We the undersigned Citizens of Callaway County in the immediate neighborhood of the residence of Henry Cooper Free man of Color would respectfully represent unto the Excellency of Thomas. E. Bramlett Govenor of Kentucky that at the June term of the Marshall Circuit Court that this- Grand Jury found an indictment against Henry Cooper charging him with commiting an assault on J. H. Cope which took place at a steam mill in Marshall county near the Callaway line at which Mill the said Cooper was employed as fireman and was dilligently attending to his work when J. H. Cope came come to the Mill highly intoxicated and went to where the defendant was and commence a difficulty with the defendant by very abusive language and choking him while out of the presence of any one but when they got to where they could be seen one witness saw the defendent strike Cope one lick with a stick. we would further represent that we have known- Cooper all of his life and that he is now and has been all of his life a good quiet peaceable Freeman and that this is the first difficulty we and only difficulty that we have ever heard of his being in and he is poor and has a large family
to support by his daily labor, upon at the Present term of the Marshall Circuit Court Henry Cooper was tried and his find assessed by the Jury at forty dollar now we think that this is case in which the clemency of the of Executive might Properly he extended and we hope that you Excellency will remit all of said find except the cost and states attorneys fee
